gcci.text: With H100 spot pricing stabilizing at $3.12/hr, hardware supply chain bottlenecks are easing as NVIDIA ramps production, but elevated capex requirements continue to favor hyperscalers over smaller cloud providers.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.28/1M reflects intensifying API price wars, with efficiency gains from model distillation creating downward pressure on margins while enabling broader accessibility for developers.

gagl.text: Annual AI infrastructure load reaching 120 TWh is pushing grid capacity limits, accelerating discussions around nuclear power adoption and renewable integration to meet sustainability targets.

aipi.text: Despite aggressive GPU and API pricing, the $3.12/hr H100 rates combined with $1.28/1M token costs suggest the AI infrastructure boom may be normalizing toward sustainable economics rather than a bubble.
